author: John Cross
title: Liverpool 0-1 Southampton (0-2) player ratings Oriol Romeu an unsung hero in EFL Cup semi-final triumph
text:
Southampton celebrate advancing to the EFL Cup final (Photo: Reuters) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Southampton reached their first major final since 2003 to leave Liverpool's season in danger of unravelling. 
Saints snatched an injury-time winner through Shane Long to win 1-0 at Anfield and prevail 2-0 on aggregate in their two-legged EFL Cup semi-final, as their hosts failed to score against them for the third time this season. 
Liverpool, eight-time winners of the competition and appearing in the last four on a record 17th occasion, were again lacking sharpness up front. Liverpool 
Must like this competition, made good saves particularly from Tadic. 
Alexander-Arnold 7 
Looks an outstanding prospect, cool and composed. Very comfortable on the ball. Liverpool's Loris Karius saves from Southampton's Dusan Tadic (Photo: Reuters) 
Lovren 6 
Of all the former Saints, he’s the one the travelling fans boo the loudest. 
Matip 6 
His return was welcome, looked assured in the heart of Liverpool’s defence. 
Milner 6 
His usual self: solid, reliable and some good set pieces. 
Henderson 6 
Not at his sharpest, but worked and tried hard as well as driving forward. 
Can 6 
His recent performances have been under heavy scrutiny. Went close. 
Lallana 6 
Worked hard, tried to make things happen from midfield. Good. 
Coutinho 7 
Bright and lively, the feel good factor of his new contract showed in his early play. 
Firmino 6 
Lively and energetic but just could not connect on a frustrating night. Liverpool's Roberto Firmino shoots at goal (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Sturridge 7 
Was lively around the box and tested Forster. Glimpses of his better form. 
Subs: Mignolet, Moreno, Lucas, Origi, Klavan, Woodburn, Wijnaldum Liverpool's Daniel Sturridge shoots over the bar (Photo: Reuters) Southampton 
Nearly dropped a clanger as he spilled Can’s shot. What a let off. 
Cedric 7 
Another good performance as he defended and stuck to his task. 
Yoshida 7 
Stood firm under heavy aerial pressure into the box. Good, solid display. 
Stephens 7 
Southampton fans sing the Harry Kane one of our song for him. They like him. Southampton's Nathan Redmond (left) and Liverpool's Jordan Henderson battle for the ball (Photo: PA) 
Bertrand 6 
Had a nervous start, gave the ball away badly a couple of times. 
Romeu 8 
MotM. One of the unsung heroes of the Premier League, such a consistent player. 
Ward-Prowse 6 
Quick and tenacious in Southampton’s midfield. Hooked early. 
Davis 7 
Blasted over one big chance but a good industrious midfield display. Shane Long fires home the winner for Southampton (Photo: REUTERS) 
Tadic 6 
Went desperately close to scoring, saw his effort blocked by Karius’s legs. 
Redmond 7 
Very dangerous on the counter attack, carried Southampton’s threat. 
Rodriguez 5 
Hooked at half time after he really struggled to get into the game. 
Substitutes 
Long, for Rodriguez, 46 mins, 6 
Hojbjerg, for Ward-Prowse, 58 mins, 6 
Subs: Lewis, Clasie, Long, Martina, Hojbjerg, McQueen, Sims Like us on Facebook
